snippet: It’s the right decision for Chen Guangcheng to study in the United States. Democracy and human rights are of great importance, but so are a family’s love and affection.
lead_paragraph: Arcadia, Calif. WHEN I was younger I was arrested twice, and sentenced twice, because I had been a leader of the 1989 Tiananmen Square democracy protests and a participant in China's civil rights movement. I was also released twice, giving me two opportunities -- once in 1993 and again in 1998 -- to make a choice between leaving China or remaining. The first time, I chose to stay. The second time, I chose to leave for America.
